intro: Acharagma huasteca, commonly known as the Huastec mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is typically found growing on the branches of oak and other broad-leaved trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Acharagma huasteca plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
